intro: Athecia glabra, commonly known as the smooth thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in the axils of the leaves. Its fruits are berries that mature to a dark purple color, containing several seeds. Athecia glabra is often found in dry, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats including roadsides and fields.
